db:abstract.db:para: Describes the size, orientation and margins of a page.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QPageLayout class defines the layout of a page in a paged document, with the page size, orientation and margins able to be set and the full page and paintable page rectangles defined by those attributes able to be queried in a variety of units.
The page size is defined by the QPageSize class which can be queried for page size attributes. Note that the QPageSize itself is always defined in a Portrait orientation.

The minimum margins can be defined for the layout but normally default to 0. When used in conjunction with Qt's printing support the minimum margins will reflect the minimum printable area defined by the printer.

In the default StandardMode the current margins and minimum margins are always taken into account. The paintable rectangle is the full page rectangle less the current margins, and the current margins can only be set to values between the minimum margins and the maximum margins allowed by the full page size.

In FullPageMode the current margins and minimum margins are not taken into account. The paintable rectangle is the full page rectangle, and the current margins can be set to any values regardless of the minimum margins and page size.

db:section.db:title: enum QPageLayout::Mode
db:section.db:para: Defines the page layout mode

db:td.db:para: Paint Rect includes margins, margins must fall between the minimum and maximum.
Paint Rect excludes margins, margins can be any value and must be managed manually.

db:section.db:title: enum QPageLayout::Orientation
db:section.db:para: This enum type defines the page orientation

db:td.db:para: The page size is used in its default orientation
The page size is rotated through 90 degrees

db:section.db:para: Note that some standard page sizes are defined with a width larger than their height, hence the orientation is defined relative to the standard page size and not using the relative page dimensions.

db:section.db:title: enum QPageLayout::Unit
db:section.db:para: This enum type is used to specify the measurement unit for page layout and margins.

db:td.db:para: 1/72th of a foot, 1/6th of an inch, 12 Points

db:section.db:title: QPageLayout::QPageLayout()
db:section.db:para: Creates an invalid QPageLayout.

db:section.db:title: QPageLayout::QPageLayout(const QPageSize &pageSize, QPageLayout::Orientation orientation, const QMarginsF &margins, QPageLayout::Unit units = Point, const QMarginsF &minMargins = QMarginsF(0, 0, 0, 0))

db:constructorsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QPageLayout(const QPageSize &pageSize, QPageLayout::Orientation orientation, const QMarginsF &margins, QPageLayout::Unit units, const QMarginsF &minMargins)

db:section.db:para: Creates a QPageLayout with the given pageSize, orientation and margins in the given units.
Optionally define the minimum allowed margins minMargins, e.g. the minimum margins able to be printed by a physical print device.
The constructed QPageLayout will be in StandardMode.
The margins given will be clamped to the minimum margins and the maximum margins allowed by the page size.

db:section.db:title: QPageLayout::QPageLayout(const QPageLayout &other)
db:section.db:para: Copy constructor, copies other to this.

db:section.db:title: QPageLayout::~QPageLayout()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the page layout.

db:section.db:title: QRectF QPageLayout::fullRect() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the full page rectangle in the current layout units.
The page rectangle takes into account the page size and page orientation, but not the page margins.

db:section.db:title: QRectF QPageLayout::fullRect(QPageLayout::Unit units) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the full page rectangle in the required units.
The page rectangle takes into account the page size and page orientation, but not the page margins.

db:section.db:title: QRect QPageLayout::fullRectPixels(int resolution) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the full page rectangle in device pixels for the given resolution.
The page rectangle takes into account the page size and page orientation, but not the page margins.

db:section.db:title: QRect QPageLayout::fullRectPoints() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the full page rectangle in Postscript Points (1/72 of an inch).
The page rectangle takes into account the page size and page orientation, but not the page margins.

db:section.db:title: bool QPageLayout::isEquivalentTo(const QPageLayout &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this page layout is equivalent to the other page layout, i.e. if the page has the same size, margins and orientation.

db:section.db:title: bool QPageLayout::isValid() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this page layout is valid.

db:section.db:title: QMarginsF QPageLayout::margins() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the margins of the page layout using the currently set units.

db:section.db:title: QMarginsF QPageLayout::margins(QPageLayout::Unit units) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the margins of the page layout using the requested units.

db:section.db:title: QMargins QPageLayout::marginsPixels(int resolution) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the margins of the page layout in device pixels for the given resolution.

db:section.db:title: QMargins QPageLayout::marginsPoints() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the margins of the page layout in Postscript Points (1/72 of an inch).

db:section.db:title: QMarginsF QPageLayout::maximumMargins() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the maximum margins that would be applied if the page layout was in StandardMode.

The maximum margins allowed are calculated as the full size of the page minus the minimum margins set. For example, if the page width is 100 points and the minimum right margin is 10 points, then the maximum left margin will be 90 points.

db:section.db:title: QMarginsF QPageLayout::minimumMargins() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the minimum margins of the page layout.

db:section.db:title: QPageLayout::Mode QPageLayout::mode() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the page layout mode.

db:section.db:title: QPageLayout::Orientation QPageLayout::orientation() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the page orientation of the page layout.

db:section.db:title: QPageSize QPageLayout::pageSize() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the page size of the page layout.
Note that the QPageSize is always defined in a Portrait orientation. To obtain a size that takes the set orientation into account you must use fullRect().

db:section.db:title: QRectF QPageLayout::paintRect() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the page rectangle in the current layout units.
The paintable rectangle takes into account the page size, orientation and margins.
If the FullPageMode mode is set then the fullRect() is returned and the margins must be manually managed.

db:section.db:title: QRectF QPageLayout::paintRect(QPageLayout::Unit units) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the page rectangle in the required units.
The paintable rectangle takes into account the page size, orientation and margins.
If the FullPageMode mode is set then the fullRect() is returned and the margins must be manually managed.

db:section.db:title: QRect QPageLayout::paintRectPixels(int resolution) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the paintable rectangle in rounded device pixels for the given resolution.
The paintable rectangle takes into account the page size, orientation and margins.
If the FullPageMode mode is set then the fullRect() is returned and the margins must be manually managed.

db:section.db:title: QRect QPageLayout::paintRectPoints() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the paintable rectangle in rounded Postscript Points (1/72 of an inch).
The paintable rectangle takes into account the page size, orientation and margins.
If the FullPageMode mode is set then the fullRect() is returned and the margins must be manually managed.

db:section.db:title: bool QPageLayout::setBottomMargin(qreal bottomMargin)
db:section.db:para: Sets the bottom page margin of the page layout to bottomMargin. Returns true if the margin was successfully set.
The units used are those currently defined for the layout. To use different units call setUnits() first.
If in the default StandardMode then the new margin must fall between the minimum margin set and the maximum margin allowed by the page size, otherwise the margin will not be set.
If in FullPageMode then any margin values will be accepted.

db:section.db:title: bool QPageLayout::setLeftMargin(qreal leftMargin)
db:section.db:para: Sets the left page margin of the page layout to leftMargin. Returns true if the margin was successfully set.
The units used are those currently defined for the layout. To use different units call setUnits() first.
If in the default StandardMode then the new margin must fall between the minimum margin set and the maximum margin allowed by the page size, otherwise the margin will not be set.
If in FullPageMode then any margin values will be accepted.

db:section.db:title: bool QPageLayout::setMargins(const QMarginsF &margins)
db:section.db:para: Sets the page margins of the page layout to margins Returns true if the margins were successfully set.
The units used are those currently defined for the layout. To use different units then call setUnits() first.
If in the default StandardMode then all the new margins must fall between the minimum margins set and the maximum margins allowed by the page size, otherwise the margins will not be set.
If in FullPageMode then any margin values will be accepted.

db:section.db:title: void QPageLayout::setMinimumMargins(const QMarginsF &minMargins)
db:section.db:para: Sets the minimum page margins of the page layout to minMargins.
It is not recommended to override the default values set for a page size as this may be the minimum printable area for a physical print device.

If the StandardMode mode is set then the existing margins will be clamped to the new minMargins and the maximum allowed by the page size. If the FullPageMode is set then the existing margins will be unchanged.

db:section.db:title: void QPageLayout::setMode(QPageLayout::Mode mode)
db:section.db:para: Sets a page layout mode to mode.

db:section.db:title: void QPageLayout::setOrientation(QPageLayout::Orientation orientation)
db:section.db:para: Sets the page orientation of the page layout to orientation.
Changing the orientation does not affect the current margins or the minimum margins.

db:section.db:title: void QPageLayout::setPageSize(const QPageSize &pageSize, const QMarginsF &minMargins = QMarginsF(0, 0, 0, 0))
db:section.db:para: Sets the page size of the page layout to pageSize.
Optionally define the minimum allowed margins minMargins, e.g. the minimum margins able to be printed by a physical print device, otherwise the minimum margins will default to 0.

If StandardMode is set then the existing margins will be clamped to the new minimum margins and the maximum margins allowed by the page size. If FullPageMode is set then the existing margins will be unchanged.

db:section.db:title: bool QPageLayout::setRightMargin(qreal rightMargin)
db:section.db:para: Sets the right page margin of the page layout to rightMargin. Returns true if the margin was successfully set.
The units used are those currently defined for the layout. To use different units call setUnits() first.
If in the default StandardMode then the new margin must fall between the minimum margin set and the maximum margin allowed by the page size, otherwise the margin will not be set.
If in FullPageMode then any margin values will be accepted.

db:section.db:title: bool QPageLayout::setTopMargin(qreal topMargin)
db:section.db:para: Sets the top page margin of the page layout to topMargin. Returns true if the margin was successfully set.
The units used are those currently defined for the layout. To use different units call setUnits() first.
If in the default StandardMode then the new margin must fall between the minimum margin set and the maximum margin allowed by the page size, otherwise the margin will not be set.
If in FullPageMode then any margin values will be accepted.

db:section.db:title: void QPageLayout::setUnits(QPageLayout::Unit units)
db:section.db:para: Sets the units used to define the page layout.

db:section.db:title: void QPageLayout::swap(QPageLayout &other)
db:section.db:para: Swaps this page layout with other. This function is very fast and never fails.

db:section.db:title: QPageLayout::Unit QPageLayout::units() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the units the page layout is currently defined in.

db:section.db:title: QPageLayout &QPageLayout::operator=(QPageLayout &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move-assigns other to this QPageLayout instance, transferring the ownership of the managed pointer to this instance.

db:section.db:title: QPageLayout &QPageLayout::operator=(const QPageLayout &other)
db:section.db:para: Assignment operator, assigns other to this.

db:section.db:title: bool operator!=(const QPageLayout &lhs, const QPageLayout &rhs)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if page layout lhs is not equal to page layout rhs, i.e. if any of the attributes differ.
Note that this is a strict equality, especially for page size where the QPageSize ID, name and size must exactly match, and the margins where the units must match.

db:section.db:title: bool operator==(const QPageLayout &lhs, const QPageLayout &rhs)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if page layout lhs is equal to page layout rhs, i.e. if all the attributes are exactly equal.
Note that this is a strict equality, especially for page size where the QPageSize ID, name and size must exactly match, and the margins where the units must match.
